page.title: 04EDUCATION IN CRICK
page.content: All children must attend school until they are 16 yrs. This is law. In Northamptonshire children start school in the September after they are 4. Some pupils stay at school until they are 18 before going on to further training. In Crick we have a primary school with 96 children between the ages of 4-11 yrs.Afterwards they all go to Guilsborough Comprehensive School. They lave Crick by bus at 8.00a.m. and return about 4.20p.m.The primary school was built in 1915 but since then it has been added to twice. We have a big hall in which we do P.E. and have our dinners. A new machine to help in teaching has recently been bought. This is a computer. We have calculators to check our work.
